document.title: Body Oddities: Hypothetical (Com)positions from the Physically Extreme

author.institution: The City College of New York

document.abstract: Relying on the anomalous physicalities of the bearded woman, the hermaphrodite, and conjoined twins, this essay explores the links between the body and its constituent performances of composing.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Mark McBeth teaches composition and rhetoric courses at The City College of New York, where he also acts as the Director of the Writing Center. He resides in Manhattan and is completing his Ph.D. at the City University of New York Graduate Center, concentrating in Composition and Rhetoric Studies and Queer Theory.
